IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO RAISE FUNDS TO ASSURE THE LONG TERM STABILITY AND EXISTENCE OF PERRY TECHNICAL INSTITUTE.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE FOUNDATION EXISTS FOR THE PURPOSE OF RAISING FUNDS TO ASSURE THE LONG TERM STABILITY AND EXISTENCE OF PERRY TECHNICAL INSTITUTE.
IRS990.Desc: THE PERRY TECHNICAL FOUNDATION SUPPORTS STUDENTS ATTENDING PERRY TECHNICAL INSTITUTE BY PROVIDING A COMPREHENSIVE SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE OFFERED TWICE A YEAR TO STUDENTS IN GOOD STANDING WHO HAVE COMPLETED ONE QUARTER. APPLICATIONS ARE REVIEWED BY A COMMITTEE OF INDEPENDENT VOLUNTEERS AND AWARDED BASED UPON A STUDENT ESSAY, GRADES, ATTENDANCE, FINANCIAL NEED AND REFERENCES. THE PERRY TECHNICAL FOUNDATION DISTRIBUTED FUNDS TO 408 STUDENTS IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS DURING THE 2022-2023 FISCAL YEAR.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: THE PERRY TECHNICAL FOUNDATION ASSISTS WITH EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS AT PERRY TECHNICAL INSTITUTE THROUGH EQUIPMENT PURCHASES AND CAPITAL IMPROVEMENTS. DURING THE 2022-2023 FISCAL YEAR, $772,660 IN EQUIPMENT FUNDS AND OPERATIONAL SUPPORT FUNDS FOR PERRY TECH INSTITUTE WERE DISBURSED. THE EQUIPMENT PURCHASES HELP ENSURE THAT PERRY TECHNICAL INSTITUTE STUDENTS ARE RECEIVING TRAINING ON HIGH QUALITY EQUIPMENT SIMILAR TO WHAT THEY WILL EXPERIENCE IN INDUSTRY.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: THE PERRY TECHNICAL FOUNDATION SUPPORTS STUDENTS ATTENDING PERRY TECHNICAL INSTITUTE BY OFFERING SMALL LOANS TO STUDENTS. LOAN FUNDS ARE AVAILABLE TO STUDENTS WITH GOOD CREDIT WHO ARE STRUGGLING WITH THE FUNDS NEEDED TO PURCHASE EQUIPMENT OR TOOLS FOR THEIR PROGRAM. LOANS ARE AVAILABLE ON A FIRST COME, FIRST SERVE BASIS TO STUDENTS WHO APPLY AND PASS THE REQUIRED CREDIT CHECK. REPAYMENT BEGINS SIX MONTHS AFTER GRADUATION. DURING THE 2022-2023 FISCAL YEAR $11,241 IN LOAN FUNDS WERE DISTRIBUTED.

BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: CATHY STERBENZ VP OF FINANCE AND ADMIN

SupportedOrganizationName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: JM PERRY INSTITUTE OF TRADES INDUSTRIES AND AGRICULTURE

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: PERRY TECHNICAL FOUNDATION IS CONTROLLED BY ITS SUPPORTED ORGANIZATION, PERRY TECHNICAL INSTITUTE, BY HAVING TWO OFFICERS AND ONE TRUSTEE OF PERRY TECHNICAL INSTITUTE ON PERRY TECHNICAL FOUNDATION BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S ENDOWMENT CONSISTS OF ELEVEN AND EIGHT INDIVIDUAL FUNDS AT JUNE 30, 2023 AND 2022, RESPECTIVELY. INDIVIDUAL FUNDS ARE ESTABLISHED FOR SCHOLARSHIPS AND EQUIPMENT INCLUDING BOTH DONOR-RESTRICTED ENDOWMENT FUNDS AND FUNDS DESIGNATED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES TO FUNCTION AS ENDOWMENTS. NET ASSETS ASSOCIATED WITH THESE ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE CLASSIFIED AND REPORTED BASED ON THE EXISTENCE OR ABSENCE OF DONOR-IMPOSED RESTRICTIONS.

THE FOUNDATION IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL AND STATE INCOME TAXES UNDER THE PROVISIONS OF SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE EXCEPT TO THE EXTENT OF UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME TAX UNDER SECTIONS 511 THROUGH 515. IN ACCORDANCE WITH REQUIREMENTS RELATED TO ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS, THE FOUNDATION HAD NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS AS OF JUNE 30, 2023 AND 2022. THE FOUNDATION FILE INCOME TAX RETURNS IN THE U.S. FEDERAL JURISDICTIONS. IN ADDITION, THE FOUNDATION HAVE NO MATERIAL UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME SUBJECT TO TAX AT JUNE 30, 2023 AND 2022.

IRS990ScheduleG.GamingManagerServicesProvTxt: OVERSEE TICKET SALES AND EVENTS; RECORDKEEPING; FEE REMITTANCE; TICKET STUB RECONCILIATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: TRESSA SCHOCKLEY AND CATHY STERBENZ ARE BOTH EMPLOYEES OF PERRY TECHNICAL INSTITUTE. THEIR COMPENSATION AS EMPLOYEES OF PERRY TECHNICAL ARE NOT SPECIFICALLY LINKED TO THEIR ACTIVITIES RELATED TO THE RAFFLE.

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: JM PERRY INSTITUTE OF TRADES INDUSTRIES AND AGRICULTURE

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: TO PROVIDE FUNDS FOR EQUIPMENT PURCHASES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: SCHOLARSHIPS ARE OFFERED TWICE A YEAR TO STUDENTS IN GOOD STANDING WHO HAVE COMPLETED ONE QUARTER. APPLICATIONS ARE REVIEWED BY A COMMITTEE OF INDEPENDENT VOLUNTEERS AND AWARDED BASED ON UPON A STUDENT ESSAY, GRADES, ATTENDANCE, FINANCIAL NEED AND REFERENCES.

CHRISTINE COTE IS THE PRESIDENT AND CATHY STERBENZ IS THE VP OF FINANCE AND ADMINISTRATION OF THE J.M. PERRY INSTITUTE OF TRADES INDUSTRIES AND AGRICULTURE, WHICH IS A RELATED ORGANIZATION TO PERRY TECHNICAL FOUNDATION. THE J.M. PERRY INSTITUTE OF TRADES INDUSTRIES AND AGRICULTURE BOARD DETERMINES AND APPROVES THE SALARY FOR THE FOUNDATION'S EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR.
NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTIONS IS THE NUMBER OF ITEMS CONTRIBUTED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION HAS ONE MEMBER, J.M. PERRY INSTITUTE OF TRADES INDUSTRIES AND AGRICULTURE, WHO RETAINS ALL VOTING RIGHTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: J.M. PERRY INSTITUTE OF TRADES INDUSTRIES AND AGRICULTURE, THE SOLE MEMBER OF THE CORPORATION, CAN ELECT NEW BOARD MEMBERS WHEN THE NUMBER OF BOARD MEMBERS INCREASES IN SIZE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE 990 AND SCHEDULE B WAS REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF J.M. PERRY INSTITUTE OF TRADES INDUSTRIES AND AGRICULTURE WHO OVERSEE THE OPERATIONS OF THE FOUNDATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR THE FOUNDATION HAVE A CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY THAT IS REVIEWED AND SIGNED BY THE BOARD ANNUALLY. THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF J.M. PERRY INSTITUTE OF TRADES INDUSTRIES AND AGRICULTURE OVERSEES THE POLICY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT MAKE ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC.

DisregardedEntityName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: JM PERRY INSTITUTE OF TRADES INDUSTRIES AND AGRICULTURE
